org.dexpi.pid.imaging

Interface GraphicFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ImageFactory

    public interface GraphicFactory
    The imageFactory creates the image and fills it with geometric shapes. The desired resolution in x direction and the size of the "ProteusXml-Drawing" are converted to a scale factor that sets the size of the ProteusXml-Drawing in relation to the size of the image and transforms the Proteus coordinates to coordinates in pixels. To allow the addition of ShapeCatalogue objects, which have relative coordinates, setScaleAnglePos() is used. The point zero of the image will be shifted and rotated according to the desired position of the object instead of transforming the relative coordinates of all its geometric objects to absolute coordinates.
    Author:
    El Pulpo

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init(int resolutionX,
          double[] origin,
          double[] size,
          java.awt.Color backgroundColor)
        Creates a basic image of a desired size and background color. Additionally the scale factor for coordinate transformation gets calculated. Once the image is created it can be filled with all kinds of geometric shapes.
        Parameters:
        resolutionX - the desired resolution in x direction (in pixels)
        origin - the point zero specified in the "Proteus" document
        size - the size specified in the "Proteus" document
        backgroundColor - the backgroundColor

      • addLine

        void addLine(java.awt.Color c,
             float lineWeight,
             double[] xCoordinates,
             double[] yCoordinates)
        adds a line to the image
        Parameters:
        c - the color
        lineWeight - the lineweight
        xCoordinates - the x-coordinates of the line
        yCoordinates - the y-coordinates of the line

      • addShape

        void addShape(java.awt.Color c,
              float lineWeight,
              double[] xCoordinates,
              double[] yCoordinates,
              boolean filled)
        adds a shape to the image
        Parameters:
        c - the color
        lineWeight - the lineweight
        xCoordinates - the x-coordinates of the shape
        yCoordinates - the y-coordinates of the shape
        filled - if filled is set to true the shape will be filled with color

      • addCircle

        void addCircle(java.awt.Color c,
               float lineWeight,
               double[] position,
               double radius,
               double startAngle,
               double endAngle,
               boolean filled)
        adds a circle to the image
        Parameters:
        c - the color
        lineWeight - the lineweight
        position - the position
        radius - the radius
        startAngle - the startAngle of the arc
        endAngle - the endAngle of the arc
        filled - if filled is set to true the circle will be filled with color

             java.lang.String Font)

        position - the position
        extent - the extent
        textAngle - the angle of the text
        string - the string
        height - the height of the text
        Font - the font

      • addEllipse

        void addEllipse(java.awt.Color c,
                float lineWeight,
                double[] position,
                double primAxis,
                double secAxis,
                double startAngle,
                double endAngle,
                boolean filled)
        adds an ellipse to the image
        Parameters:
        c - the color
        lineWeight - the lineweight
        position - the position
        primAxis - the height/primary axis of the ellipse
        secAxis - the width/secondary axis of the ellipse
        startAngle - the startAngle of the arc
        endAngle - the endAngle of the arc
        filled - if filled is set to true the ellipse will be filled with color

      • setScaleAnglePos

        void setScaleAnglePos(double[] reference,
                      double[] scale,
                      double[] position)
        Shifts and rotates the coordinate system to draw elements from the shapeCatalogue
        Parameters:
        reference - the reference, rotates the image. The two numbers represent the cosinus and sinus of the desired angle.
        scale - the scale
        position - the position a shapeCatalogue-element should be drawn to

      • resetScaleAnglePos

        void resetScaleAnglePos()
        resets scale, angle and position

      • buildImage

        java.awt.image.BufferedImage buildImage()
        Returns:
        the final image

      • addImageMapElement

        void addImageMapElement(PidElement pidElement)
        Creates an imageMapElement of a pidElement. The imageMapElement basically defines the area occupied by the pidElement. This allows to display of additional information when hovering over this area with the mouse, if used in a html website.
        Parameters:
        pidElement - the pidElement

      • getImageMapObjects

        java.util.List<ImageMapObject> getImageMapObjects()
        All imageMapObjects created are added to a list and can be returned if desired.
        Returns:
        a list of all imageMapObjects created
